subject: [R] p-value and significance code
body:
Dear R list members.

Is there anyone out there that might be able to explain the difference
between p-values and significance codes for terms in a linear
regression model (as given by summary.lm for example) for me please?

Do they both give the probability that the observed variation in the
dependent variable due to a given term (or all terms, depending how
they are used) in the model could have been obtained by chance for
example?

I am confused because I have an article which refers to p-values for
individual terms in a linear regression model. They happen to use the
same star syntax when referring to p-values as R's summary.lm command
does for significance codes. R's summary command only gives one
p-value for the whole model though. I have tried searching for help on
"significance code" in the R docs and this list to see what it is
actually being calculated, but to no avail.

Thanks,

Paul

______________________________________________
R-help@stat.math.ethz.ch mailing list
https://stat.ethz.ch/mailman/listinfo/r-help
PLEASE do read the posting guide http://www.R-project.org/posting-guide.html
and provide commented, minimal, self-contained, reproducible code.
